title: How many people in the US still use an iPhone 4? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s December, 2017, and I’m still very happily using my iPhone 4s! Yes, I loved my 7 Plus, but I couldn’t afford the contract anymore, and I qualified for FREE service with another carrier. When they told me I could have an iPhone for just $50 (not per month, but a one-time payment) I jumped on it! Would I like it if I were working with a decent amount of memory? Of course. Am I angry as hell that I can’t seem to just bring in a newer model from eBay and transfer my free service over to it? You bet! Does it run slowly? Sure. But I can use the TV app on just fine. And all the other stuff works perfectly! So, all in all I’d have to say: EVEN AN OLDER iPHONE WORKS GREAT, MEANING THERE’S NO NEED TO UPGRADE! THERE’S A DESIRE, MAYBE, BUT NOT AN ACTUAL NEED. THANKS, Apple!

January 2019, I still use my iPhone 4 for music (the Pandora app still works!), recording voice journals and nature sounds (it has an excellent mic compared to cheap cruddy phones I’ve had to use), sending emails, managing reminders, taking notes, playing games, and as a much-needed small-enough-to-fit-in-my-pocket noise machine (using earbuds and the Relax Melodies app). I love the size, look and feel of this old thing. It’s the only iPhone I’ve had and I got it for free with my phone plan. For me it’s more of a side-device, a “fun phone” to take with me places in addition to my newer Android smartphone. It’s comforting having it around still.
